channel.title: Dustin Dikes - Week Notes
channel.description: Updates of the things I have done each week

item.title: Week Notes 2026-04
item.dc:creator: Dustin Dikes
item.description:
ğŸ“… Week of 2026-01-19 - 2026-01-25

I've followed Noisy Deadline's blog for a while now, and I always loved seeing her week notes. Week notes are an indie web concept where you publish a post at the end of each week detailing things you did. I decided I'd document my studying within the infosec space through week notes.

ğŸ“š Read

  • HTB How to Become a Pentester This was a nice intro guide on how to get started in pentesting. It actually inspired me to do these week notes. Having a blog showing continual learning should be helpful to set me apart when I'm looking for a job. I'm going to also start doing more CTFs and things like HTB machines to build my skills and to post write-ups for them.

ğŸ¥ Watched

  • Nahamsec - This simple vulnerability was worth $70,000
  • Talking Sasquach - BLEShark Nano: Pocket Sized WiFi Security Testing!

ğŸ§ Listened

  • The OSINT Podcast - Ep 2
    • Paste Gmail address in sheets, hover over it, may give you name and confirm it's an account
    • Url for confirming valid Gmail account with calendar (src): https[:]//calendar[.]google[.]com/calendar/u/0/embed?src=youremail@example[.]com
  • Dark Diaries Podcast - Ep 166: Maxie This was a fun episode. I always love hearing stories of physical pen tests. The underwater data center bit was interesting as well.

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Hacked:

  • Completed HTB File Inclusion Module
  • Set up this blog!

ğŸ« School

  • Studying for the CompTIA Project+ certificate

item.title: Week Notes 2026-05
item.dc:creator: Dustin Dikes
item.description:
ğŸ“… Week of 2026-01-25 - 2026-01-31

ğŸ“š Read

  • Beauty in Destruction: Exploring Malware's Impact Through Art I didn't know Malware based at exhibits existed. That is something that's right up my alley. I've always been very into art and computers and have a particular affinity for intersection of technology and art.

ğŸ¥ Watched

  • Nahamsec - How to Become a Top Bug Bounty Hunter in 2026
  • Talking Sasquach - This 5GHz WiFi Device is INSANE

ğŸ§ Listened

  • OSINT Podcast episode 3 - The Dark Side of OSINT

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Hacked

  • I've been working through the OSINT Newsletter CTF

ğŸ« School

  • Studying for the CompTIA Project+ certificate

item.title: Week Notes 2026-06
item.dc:creator: Dustin Dikes
item.description:
ğŸ“… Week of 2026-02-02 - 2026-02-08

ğŸ•’ Current

  • Reading: Hunting Cyber Criminals by Vinny Troia

ğŸ¥ Watched

  • NahamSec - Hacking a Windows Web Application
    • Shortscan
    • FFUF flag -ac for color
  • NahamSec - No Code Bug Bounty Automation Using n8n
  • NahamSec - Best Hacking Tools For 2026
    • Proxy: Caido, BurpSuite, Zapp
    • Subdomain enumeration: subfinder, amass
    • Fuzzing: FFUF, gobuster
    • Wayback machine: waymore
    • Crawler: katana
    • Blind XSS scan: easyXSS
    • Vulnerability Scanner: Nuclei
    • To watch: NahamSec recon methodology video

ğŸ§ Listened

  • Darknet Diaries - EP 168: LoD
  • Darknet Diaries - EP 169: MoD

ğŸ« School

  • Studying for CompTIA Project+

ğŸ†• Misc

  • installed Omarchy. I have previously set up my own system with i3, but after watching the Omarchy demo video I knew this would be perfect for me. My workflows align very well with those of the creator, so I figured I'd jump ship and give it a go. So far I'm loving it!
  • Coached at the Spokane Cyber Cup CTF! It was really fun, and we had a great turnout of talented student hackers!

  • Coached at the Spokane Cyber Cup CTF! It was really fun, and we had a great turnout of talented student hackers!

item.title: Week Notes 2026-07
item.dc:creator: Dustin Dikes
item.description:
ğŸ“… Week of 2026-02-09 - 2026-02-15

ğŸ•’ Current

  • Reading: Hunting Cyber Criminals by Vinny Troia
  • Working through HTB Pentest in a Nutshell
  • Watching: Johnny Mnemonic

ğŸ“š Read

  • Jailbreaking LLMs: A Comprehensive Guide (With Examples)

ğŸ¥ Watched

  • Finished Cyberpunk: Edgerunners This was a great anime. I loved the cyberpunk feel. Very Neuromancer. I've not played/read anything else from the Cyberpunk 2077 franchise, but I definitely want to dive deeper into this world!

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Hacked

  • GraySwan Arena - Safeguards Wave 0 (Red Team) - I managed to break the LLM for the first time, so that was exciting!
  • Snyk Fetch the Flag 2026 CTF - This was a fun CTF! I worked on it with two other Defcon 509 members. We successfully completed all flags (10 of them) in the digital forensics section. This challenge provided a very large pcap file and a list of questions where the answers are the flag. You had to find the answers based on what you could find in the pcap file. We also tried our hands at the web challenges and AI challenges, but didn't manage to get any flags there. Overall it was really fun doing a CTF with a team!

ğŸ« School

  • Studying for CompTIA Project+
item.content:encoded:
ğŸ“… Week of 2026-02-09 - 2026-02-15

ğŸ•’ Current

  • Reading: Hunting Cyber Criminals by Vinny Troia
  • Working through HTB Pentest in a Nutshell
  • Watching: Johnny Mnemonic

ğŸ“š Read

  • Jailbreaking LLMs: A Comprehensive Guide (With Examples)

ğŸ¥ Watched

  • Finished Cyberpunk: Edgerunners This was a great anime. I loved the cyberpunk feel. Very Neuromancer. I've not played/read anything else from the Cyberpunk 2077 franchise, but I definitely want to dive deeper into this world!

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Hacked

  • GraySwan Arena - Safeguards Wave 0 (Red Team) - I managed to break the LLM for the first time, so that was exciting!
  • Snyk Fetch the Flag 2026 CTF - This was a fun CTF! I worked on it with two other Defcon 509 members. We successfully completed all flags (10 of them) in the digital forensics section. This challenge provided a very large pcap file and a list of questions where the answers are the flag. You had to find the answers based on what you could find in the pcap file. We also tried our hands at the web challenges and AI challenges, but didn't manage to get any flags there. Overall it was really fun doing a CTF with a team!

ğŸ« School

  • Studying for CompTIA Project+
